page.title: 06Clubs & Recreation, Shepreth
page.content: The Shepreth Womens Institute started possibly in the 1930's. There are 30 members and activities include bring and buy stalls, produce stalls and lunches for the community in the village hall. They have raised money and redecorated the village hall. They have trips out, have visiting speakers and generally join in all community projects in the village. The W I meets once a month in the village hall. The village hall is used by clubs and to hold village events eg, dances, discos, indoor bowling club, keep fit, tennis, cricket and football club, and council meetings. It is run by a committee of representatives from these groups.
